title: Portrait of Auguste Renoir

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on canvas.

inscriptions: Albert Andre in lower left corner
publication_history:
Paris, Galeries Durand-Ruel, Tableaux par Albert André exh. cat. (1913), cat. 37.

The Art Institute of Chicago, Forty-Second Annual Report (Chicago: The Art Institue: 1920), n.p. (ill.)

Toronto Art Gallery, Exhibition of Paintings by French Artists (Toronto: Art gallery, 1922), cat. 2

"Coming Exhibitions," Bulletin of the Art Institute of Chicago 14, no. 6 (1920): 84 (ill.).

M. B. W., "Portrait of Monet by André," Bulletin of the Art Institute of Chicago 17 no. 3 (March 1923): 32.

M. C., "Renoirs in the Art Institute," Bulletin of the Art Institute of Chicago 19, no. 3 (1925):
32 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago, A Guide to the Paintings in the Permanent Collection (Chicago: Art Institute: 1925), 74 (ill.), 125 no. 603.

Marius Mermillon, Albert André (Paris: G. Crès & cie, c. 1927), plate 17.

Meyric R. Rogers, "Interiors of Renoir's Home by Albert André." Bulletin of the City Art Museum of St. Louis 17, no. 2 (April 1932): 18.

Art Institute of Chicago, A Guide to the Paintings in the Permanent Collection (Chicago: Art Institute: 1932), 75 (ill.), 141.

Catalogue of A Century of Progress: Exhibition of Painting and Sculpture Lent from American Collections. Exh. cat. (Chicago: The Art Institute, 1933), 46 cat. 321.

A Century of Progress Exhibition of Painting and Sculpture. Exh. cat. (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1934) pp. 43 cat. 267.

C. J. Bulliet, The Significant Moderns and Their Pictures (New York: Covici/Friede, 1936), plate 199. 

Paintings by Albert André (Chicago: The Arts Club of Chicago, 1941) cat. 18.

Pierre Auguste Renoir, 1841-1919: Paintings Drawings, Prints and Sculpture. Exh. cat. (Los Angeles, Calif. : Los Angeles County Museum, 1955), 29, 58 cat. 92 (incorrectly dated).

Art Institute of Chicago, Paintings in the Art Institute: A Catalogue of the Picture Collection (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 1961) 15.

Faber Birren, "Palettes of the Old Masters: What better way to learn color than from such Masters as El Greco, Rembrandt, Van Gogh, and Joseph Turner," American Artist 35, no. 2 (February 1971), 43 (ill.) (repr. only, no text).

A. James Speyer, Twentieth-Century European Paintings, compiled by Courtney Graham Donnell. (Chicago and London: The University of Chicago Press, 1980), 13, 31 no. 1A6, plate 1A6.
exhibition_history:
Paris, Galeries Durand-Ruel, Tableaux par Albert André, Apr. 7-19, 1913, cat. 37.

Toronto, Toronto Art Gallery, Exhibition of Paintings by French Artists, Jan. 6–Feb. 5, 1922, cat. 2.

Art Institute of Chicago, A Century of Progress: Exhibition of Painting and Sculpture Lent from American Collections, June 1-Nov. 1, 1933, cat. 321.

Art Institute of Chicago, A Century of Progress Exhibition of Painting and Sculpture, June 1-Nov. 1, 1934, cat. 267.


Chicago, Arts Club, Paintings by Albert André, January 31 - February 28, 1941, cat. 18.

Los Angeles County Museum, Pierre Auguste Renoir, 1841-1919: Paintings Drawings, Prints and Sculpture, July 14-Aug. 21, 1955, cat. 92, pp. 92, 29 (ill.); San Francisco Museum of Art, Sep. 1-Oct. 2, 1955 (incorrectly dated).
provenance_text: The artist; sold to Durand-Ruel, Paris, Apr. 7, 1913 [corresondence with France Daguet, Durand-Ruel & Cie., Mar. 7, 1986, in curatorial object file]; sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, Mar. 25, 1920.
